org.kepler.provenance.prov

Class ProvQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kepler.provenance.DefaultQuery
      • org.kepler.provenance.prov.ProvQuery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, Queryable

    public class ProvQuery
extends DefaultQuery
    A class to query provenance in PROV serializations.
    Author:
    Daniel Crawl

      Create a new ProvQuery for a PROV serialization in the specified file.

                                                         throws QueryException

        Specified by:
        getActorFiringForToken in interface Queryable
        Overrides:
        getActorFiringForToken in class DefaultQuery
        Parameters:
        tokenId - the token id
        read - If true, return the actor(s) firing id(s) that read the token. Otherwise, return the actor firing that wrote the token.

        QueryException

      • getTimestampsForExecution

        public java.util.Date[] getTimestampsForExecution(int execId)
                                           throws QueryException
        Get the start and stop timestampes for a workflow execution id.
        Specified by:
        getTimestampsForExecution in interface Queryable
        Overrides:
        getTimestampsForExecution in class DefaultQuery
        Parameters:
        execId - the execution id
        Returns:
        a two-element array: the first entry is the start timestamp, and the second is the end timestamp. If the execution id is not found, returns null.
        Throws:
        QueryException

      • getTimestampsForTokenRead

        public java.util.Date[] getTimestampsForTokenRead(java.lang.Integer tokenId)
                                           throws QueryException
        Get the timestamp(s) when a token was read. If a token was never read, this can return null or an empty array.
        Specified by:

      • getTokensForExecution

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getTokensForExecution(int execId,
                                                               java.lang.Integer portId,
                                                               boolean last)
                                                        throws QueryException
        Get an sequence of tokens for an execution.
        Specified by:
        getTokensForExecution in interface Queryable
        Overrides:
        getTokensForExecution in class DefaultQuery
        Parameters:
        execId - the execution id
        portId - the port id. If null, returns a the ids of tokens read in entire execution.
        last - if true, the sequence starts at the last token created and goes backwards to the first; otherwise the sequence starts at the first.
        Throws:
        QueryException

      • getTokensForFiring

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getTokensForFiring(int fireId,
                                                            boolean read)

        Specified by:
        getTokensForFiring in interface Queryable
        Overrides:
        getTokensForFiring in class DefaultQuery
        Parameters:
        fireId - the firing id
        read - if true, get the tokens read; otherwise get the tokens written.

        QueryException

      • getChannelForToken

        public java.lang.Integer getChannelForToken(int tokenId,
                                            boolean read,
                                            java.lang.Integer fireId)
                                     throws QueryException
        Get the channel that a token was read or written on.
        Specified by:
        getChannelForToken in interface Queryable
        Overrides:
        getChannelForToken in class DefaultQuery
        Parameters:
        tokenId - the token id
        read - if true, return the channel the token was read on. otherwise, return the channel the token was written on.
        fireId - the actor firing id. can be null for writes, but must be specified for reads.
        Returns:
        the channel the token was read or written on.
        Throws:
        QueryException

      • _stringTokenValuesHaveSurroundingQuotes

        protected boolean _stringTokenValuesHaveSurroundingQuotes()
        Returns false since ProvRecording saves StringToken values using StringToken.stringValue(), which does not add surrounding double-quotes.
        Specified by:
        _stringTokenValuesHaveSurroundingQuotes in class DefaultQuery
